Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Point api/v2/curated-feeds to main V2 feed" (#7697) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Address https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7689.

We've been returning all packages for the "microsoftdotnet" feed for quite a while now. I think it's safe to formalize this even more by making the calls go through our main V2 controller. This helps reduce code and makes the server-side cache be shared between two endpoints that currently behave the almost the same. Differences are: 

1. The `/Packages()` endpoint returned at most 40 on the curated feed controller. This will become 100 which is the max in the non-curated feed controller.
1. Non-existent curated feeds will now 200 and behave no different than the "microsoftdotnet" feed. Note that "microsoftdotnet" accounts for 99.89% of the requests so I don't think this is a big deal.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""Dependent repositories" is not great wording" (#7677) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
If I could make one suggestion: change the wording in the "info" sidebar from "Dependent repositories (223+)" to "Github Usage: 223+ repositories".

Even for native speakers, I feel pretty confident that a lot of people are going to read "Dependent repositories" and think it means how many dependencies the nuget package has, which is exactly the opposite of what you want to communicate, and may scare people away.

Sticking with "Github usage" is more consistent with the other new section on the page, too.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Allow to specify KeyVault cert store and location." (#7693) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/1912.

Added two new optional configuration settings:
* KeyVault.StoreName
* KeyVault.StoreLocation

Allows to override the default LocalMachine/My store for keyvault cert.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Merge dev into master for deployment" (#7698) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue ""The underlying connection was closed: An unexpected error occurred on a send" when using nuget CLI" (#7669) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
@Arun-ANIT commented on [Wed Oct 30 2019](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8773)

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): Nuget.exe CLI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 2.2.0

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 2.2.0

We use nuget.exe with teamcity to download and add packages to our .NET builds. We are facing an issue with this since yesterday. We are getting the below error.

C:\TeamCity\buildAgent\tools\NuGet.CommandLine.2.2.0.nupkg\tools>nuget list -Sou
rce https://nuget.org/api/v2 -verbosity detailed
The underlying connection was closed: An unexpected error occurred on a send.

The same works fine with nuget.exe 4.5.1 but unfortunately we cant update to that right away without testing and approvals.

No changes were made on our servers that will affect the connection.

This issue is halting all our deployments. Please let us know if you need anything else.

Any help is appreciated.

Thanks,
Arun

---

@rrelyea commented on [Fri Nov 01 2019](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8773#issuecomment-548955498)

hold on...

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Setup instructions cannot create database(s)" (#7699) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
When I clone the project and go through the setup instructions, specifically running `.\tools\Setup-DevEnvironment.ps1` I get errors on the database creation steps:

`[BEGIN] Running Migrations
Updating Nuget Gallery database...
ERROR: Method not found: 'System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.IndexConfiguration System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.EntityTypeConfiguration`1.HasIndex(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<System.Func`2<!0,!!0>>)'.
Updating Nuget Gallery Support request database...
ERROR: Method not found: 'System.Data.Common.DbConnection System.Data.Entity.Core.Common.DbProviderServices.CloneDbConnection(System.Data.Common.DbConnection)'.
Update Complete!
[DONE] Running Migrations`

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Clone project
2. Run `.\build`
3. Run `.\tools\Setup-DevEnvironment.ps1`
4. See error

### Expected behavior
Expect database creation to occur so that project can run successfully.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "install fails with exception" (#6735) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

I'm trying to compile my project but nuget install fails.
Do you have any idea? (Is it related to endianness? PPC64 is big-endian)

- NuGet version: 4.5.1.4879
- OS version: CentOS Linux release 7.4.1708 (AltArch) / PPC64
- mono version: 
```
Mono JIT compiler version 5.10.1.12 (tarball 2018年  3月 24日 土曜日 12:35:22 JST)
Copyright (C) 2002-2014 Novell, Inc, Xamarin Inc and Contributors. www.mono-project.com
	TLS:           __thread
	SIGSEGV:       altstack
	Notifications: epoll
	Architecture:  ppc
	Disabled:      none
	Misc:          softdebug 
	Interpreter:   yes
	GC:            sgen (concurrent by default)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Native Dependencies inside NuGet packages not copied into Xamarin.Android APKs " (#8831) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Apologies if this is the wrong place--this seems like it could very well sit somewhere between a) my own fault, b) NuGet, c) MSBuild, or d) The Xamarin.Android build process. I thought I'd start here.

I'm working on a Xamarin Forms project with a dependency on a NuGet package that bundles a native library. That native library is correctly copied into a UWP package's `.appx`, and appropriately P/Invokable. The library's Android version is _not_ copied into the resultant `.apx`, and when the NuGet package attempts P/Invoking, it fails with a predictable DllNotFoundException.

The NuGet package in question is version 1.0.5.1 of this package: https://www.nuget.org/packages/ScannitSharp/. The source code of that version can be found here: https://github.com/pingzing/ScannitSharp/tree/b5353392bd5eccf2db27f6156a97f3e393b634c2

I have a native library using the `android-arm` and `android-arm64` Runtime IDs. They are included in a `/runtimes/<plat-arch>/native` folder, as specified in the docs. I can confirm that the resulting .nupkg contains the folder structure and .dlls, .sos and .dylibs as expected.

The dependency chain of the consuming Xamarin Forms project looks something like this:

```
-----ScannitSharp NuGet Package----- 
|   - scannit_core_ffi.so          |
|   - (other runtime dlls, etc)    |
------------------------------------
                 ^
                 |                 
-----Xamarin.Forms Core Project-----
| - Imports ScannitSharp NuGet     |
------------------------------------
                  ^
                  |
-------Xamarin Android Project------
| - Imports Xamarin Forms Core Proj|
| - Produces APK                   |
------------------------------------
```

## Details about Problem

**NuGet product used:** 

VS UI

**VS version (if appropriate):** 

16.3.7

**OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):** 

Windows 10 1903 (18362.476)

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Produce a NuGet package that include a native DLL for `android-arm` and `android-arm64`. Make sure the native libraries are stored in the `runtimes/<plat-arch>/native/` folders of the `.nupkg`.

2. Create a Xamarin Forms project with at least a .NET Standard and Android project.

3. Add the NuGet package to the .NET Standard Xamarin Forms library.

4. Build the Android project. Observe lack of native library in resulting APK.

...

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Done! Minimal sample included. A basically-blank Xamarin Forms project that uses the ScannitSharp NuGet package.

[NugetTest.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3855593/NugetTest.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test FrameworkDependecy_DifferentFlags_AffectCompare is broken in netcoreapp5.0" (#8830) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Our unit test FrameworkDependecy_DifferentFlags_AffectCompare will call System.Enum.CompareTo method.
According to the [document,](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.enum.compareto?view=netframework-4.7.2) , the return value should be:
```
Value 			Meaning
Less than zero 		The value of this instance is less than the value of target. 
Zero 			The value of this instance is equal to the value of target. 
Greater than zero 	The value of this instance is greater than the value of target. -or- target is null.
``` 
This method in netcoreapp5.0 acts just the same with the document, so this test is broken(return 65535 when comparing ushort.MaxValue and 0) for netcoreapp5.0. 
Although net472 and netcoreapp2.1 returns 1 when comparing ushort.MaxValue and 0, we should change this test to adapt all frameworks.

Closed issue "Protocol diagnostics aggregation" (#8757) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Aggregate protocol diagnostics per restore/search, per source.

information such as:
* number of requests
* minimum request duration
* mean request duration
* max request duration
* source type (http vs local, v2 vs v3)
